events.title: Jennifer Tucker on Outlaw Capital: Everyday Illegalities and the Making of Uneven Development | City & Regional Planning Lecture
events.description: A lecture by Jennifer Tucker discussing outlaw capital and its role in uneven development. This event explores the intricacies of city and regional planning.

events.title: Kaffeeklatsch
events.description: A casual social gathering for students and faculty. This event offers an opportunity for informal networking and discussion.

events.title: Analytics for Retail Supply Chains (Amitabh Sinha, Amazon)
events.description: A talk by Amitabh Sinha from Amazon on the application of analytics in retail supply chains. This session offers insights into industry best practices and technological advancements.

events.title: Discussion | El Salvador - The Past is Prologue
events.description: A discussion event focusing on the historical context of El Salvador and its implications for the present. This session encourages critical analysis of political and social developments.

events.title: Laurie Olin + Walter Hood in Conversation | Public Land, Public Space, Public Discourse
events.description: A conversation between renowned landscape architects Laurie Olin and Walter Hood exploring themes of public land, space, and discourse. The discussion delves into design, community, and environmental impact.

events.title: State and Local Reforms to Development Impact Fees: Practical Steps Toward Transparency and Equity
events.description: A presentation and discussion on proposed reforms to development impact fees at state and local levels. The event aims to identify practical steps for enhancing transparency and equity in urban development.

events.title: The rise of the strongman presidency
events.description: A lecture or discussion examining the global phenomenon of the rise of strongman presidencies. The event will analyze historical and contemporary political trends.

events.title: CAS 2026 Annual Lecture - Africa's Ill-fitting Imperial Clothes
events.organizer: Center for African Studies (CAS), UC Berkeley
events.description: The annual lecture from the Center for African Studies exploring the historical and contemporary challenges faced by African nations. This academic event fosters discussion on post-colonial identity and governance.

events.title: Unmentionables: Textiles, Garment Work, and the Syrian American Working Class
events.description: A presentation delving into the history and experiences of the Syrian American working class through the lens of textiles and garment work. This academic talk highlights social and economic narratives.

events.title: Graduate Student Community & Resource Connection
events.location: Inclusive Excellence Hub, 103 Conference Room, 2515 Channing Way, Berkeley
events.description: An event for graduate students to connect, build community, and learn about available campus resources and student organizations. Open to all UC Berkeley community members.

events.title: Bruce Liu, piano
events.description: The 2021 International Chopin Piano Competition winner, Bruce Liu, makes his Cal Performances debut with a program featuring works by Chopin, Beethoven, and more.

events.title: Introducing the Agentic AI Risk Management Profile
events.description: A presentation introducing a new framework for managing risks associated with agentic AI systems. This seminar covers critical topics in AI ethics and governance.

events.title: Berkeley Book Chat with Julia Fawcett
events.description: An engaging book chat session featuring author Julia Fawcett. This event provides an opportunity for literary discussion and interaction.

events.title: Beyond Policing: How Streetcorner Mediators Keep the Peace Without State Violence
events.description: A discussion exploring alternative methods of maintaining peace through streetcorner mediation, independent of state violence. This academic session highlights community-led conflict resolution strategies.

events.title: Social belonging in Mycenaean chamber tombs: an interdisciplinary multiproxy analysis
events.description: An interdisciplinary analysis of social belonging as evidenced in Mycenaean chamber tombs. This academic seminar delves into ancient societal structures and archaeological findings.

events.title: Environmental and Energy Economics Seminar – Diego Kanzig, Northwestern University
events.description: A seminar featuring Diego Kanzig from Northwestern University, presenting his latest research on environmental and energy economics. This academic event is part of a series discussing pressing issues in energy policy.

events.title: Shape of Thought: A Hands-On Display of Artist Books
events.description: A hands-on display showcasing a collection of unique artist books. This event offers an interactive experience with books as works of art.

events.title: Sitting Still: Film Screening | Public Land, Public Space, Public Discourse
events.description: A film screening as part of the ongoing 'Public Land, Public Space, Public Discourse' series. The event aims to stimulate discussion on civic engagement and environmental issues.

events.title: Open: Art Lab
events.description: A drop-in art making session where visitors of all ages can explore their creativity through hands-on activities. All materials are provided, fostering artistic expression in a relaxed environment.

events.title: Problem of the Month: Empathy & Ideation
events.description: Problem of the Month: Empathy & Ideation

events.title: Beyond the Handshake with Ross Weiner in conversation with Jocelyn Mangan: How personal relationships drive board of director opportunities
events.description: A conversation exploring the power of personal relationships in securing board of director positions. This event offers insights into executive networking and career development.

events.title: The Loft Hour: Chris Batterman Cháirez + Cathy Lu
events.description: An informal lunch discussion featuring arts faculty members Chris Batterman Cháirez (Music) and Cathy Lu (Art Practice). They will discuss their work in an engaging conversation.

events.title: Accelerating Chemistry and Materials Innovation with NVIDIA ALCHEMI
events.description: A presentation on leveraging NVIDIA ALCHEMI to accelerate innovation in chemistry and materials science. This session highlights advanced computational tools for scientific research.

events.title: REI Colloquium: How Schools Make Race: Teaching Latinx Racialization in America
events.description: A colloquium examining the role of educational institutions in the racialization of Latinx communities in America. This academic discussion explores critical issues in race and education.

events.title: Latinx Thriving Initiatives (LTI): Graduate Student Convivencia
events.description: A social gathering for graduate students as part of the Latinx Thriving Initiatives. This event aims to foster community and support among Latinx graduate students.

events.title: Language & AI Conference 2026: Thinking Outside the (Black) Box: Language & AI Across the UCs
events.description: A conference bringing together scholars from across UC campuses to discuss the intersection of AI with language, literature, and cultural studies. This interdisciplinary event explores critical questions in AI research.

events.title: Integral Taiji and Qigong
events.description: Join a Friday late morning session of Integral Taiji and Qigong. This class offers participants a chance to engage in mindful movement and relaxation in a beautiful garden setting.

events.title: Valentine's Day Celebration at the Student Union
events.location: 1st Floor of MLK Jr. Building, Game Zone Area, UC Berkeley
events.description: Celebrate Valentine's Day with friends at the Student Union, featuring free treats, crafts, and various activities. This event provides a festive atmosphere for students to socialize.

events.title: Discussion with Michaela Mahlberg
events.description: An in-person, collaborative deep dive with Bellwether Lecturer Michaela Mahlberg, a distinguished corpus linguist. This session provides an opportunity for in-depth academic exchange.

events.title: Composition Colloquium: Curtis Rumrill: What the Interference Took
events.location: Wu Performance Hall (Morrison Hall, Room 125), UC Berkeley
events.description: A composition colloquium featuring Curtis Rumrill, presenting his work 'What the Interference Took'. This event is free and open to the public, offering insights into contemporary musical composition.

events.title: Symbiosis & Cocktails: Lichen Love
events.location: Julia Morgan Hall, UC Botanical Garden at Berkeley
events.description: A pre-Valentine's day cocktail hour celebrating the intricate world of symbiosis in plants, with a special focus on lichens. This engaging event combines botany with a social setting.

events.title: Abortion and Reproductive Justice: An Essential Guide for Resistance
events.description: A vital discussion on abortion and reproductive justice, providing guidance for resistance and advocacy. This event addresses current legal and social challenges.

events.title: Film Screening: She's the Man
events.description: Enjoy a fun movie night with a screening of the hilarious romantic comedy 'She's the Man.' This event is free to all UC Berkeley students, offering a relaxing social evening.

events.title: FAMILY PROGRAM: Botanical Valentine's Tea (Morning Session)
events.description: The annual tradition returns with a lovely botanical tea in honor of Valentine's Day, designed for families. This program offers a charming and educational experience.

events.title: FAMILY PROGRAM: Botanical Valentine's Tea (Afternoon Session)
events.description: The annual tradition returns with a lovely botanical tea in honor of Valentine's Day, designed for families. This program offers a charming and educational experience.

events.title: Martha Graham Dance Company: GRAHAM100
events.description: The renowned Martha Graham Dance Company returns to Cal Performances to celebrate its 100th anniversary with a program of classic Graham works and new creations. This iconic company showcases the power and beauty of modern dance.

events.title: 2026 Cal Invitational Speech and Debate Tournament
events.description: The annual Cal Invitational Speech and Debate Tournament featuring various events for high school students. This multi-day competition showcases academic and oratorical skills.

events.title: Discovery Station: Newts
events.description: A drop-in Discovery Station event offering an up-close look at newts and educational information from volunteer docents. This family-friendly program provides insights into local wildlife.

events.title: Climate Journalism on Screen: Only on Earth
events.description: A screening of 'Only on Earth' as part of the Climate Journalism on Screen series. This film explores environmental themes and the role of journalism in climate discourse.

events.title: Swedish Silent Cinema: A Man There Was & The Wind
events.description: A double feature from the Swedish Silent Cinema series, showcasing 'A Man There Was' and 'The Wind.' This cinematic experience is introduced by UC Berkeley faculty.

events.title: In the Mood for Love: The Films of Wong Kar Wai: My Blueberry Nights
events.description: A screening of Wong Kar Wai's 'My Blueberry Nights,' presented as part of a series celebrating his iconic films. This event offers a unique cinematic experience.

events.title: Lunar New Year Event at the Student Union
events.location: MLK Game Zone, 1st Floor of MLK Jr. Building, UC Berkeley
events.description: Celebrate the Lunar New Year with free treats and festivities at the Student Union. This event is free to UC Berkeley students, fostering cultural exchange and community spirit.

events.title: Real Work, Real Conversations
events.description: Real Work, Real Conversations

events.title: Noon Concert: Chamber Music
events.description: A free noon concert featuring students from the UC Berkeley Symphony Orchestra performing small ensemble chamber works. The program includes Johannes Brahms' Piano Trio in B Major Op. 8.

events.title: Music Studies Colloquium: Flora Willson: “Down the Line: In Search of Operatic Infrastructures”
events.description: A music studies colloquium featuring Flora Willson, discussing 'Down the Line: In Search of Operatic Infrastructures.' This academic event offers new perspectives on opera history and theory.

events.title: Frederick Wiseman: America at Work: Model
events.description: A screening of Frederick Wiseman's documentary 'Model,' part of the 'America at Work' series. The film offers an unvarnished look at institutional life in America.

events.title: Open: Art Lab
events.description: A drop-in art making session where visitors of all ages can explore their creativity through hands-on activities. All materials are provided, fostering artistic expression in a relaxed environment.

events.title: Problem of the Month: From Ideas to Experiments
events.description: Problem of the Month: From Ideas to Experiments

events.title: Frederick Wiseman: America at Work: Meat
events.description: A screening of Frederick Wiseman's documentary 'Meat,' offering a penetrating look into industrial food production. This film is part of the 'America at Work' series.

events.title: Blind Box Charms Crafting
events.organizer: UC Berkeley Student Union (in partnership with Cub Concerts at Berkeley)
events.description: Take a break from studying to create your own unique blind box charms. This free event for UC Berkeley students combines crafting with a social atmosphere and music.

events.title: Botanical Illustration: Spring Bulbs
events.description: A focused workshop on botanical illustration techniques, emphasizing the beauty and detail of spring bulbs. Participants will learn to capture the essence of these seasonal flora.

events.title: Friday Concert: Piano Recital (featuring Christopher Harto)
events.description: A Friday concert featuring pianist Christopher Harto performing an all-American program. The recital includes works by Adams, Ives, Gershwin, and Rzewski.

events.title: Composition Colloquium: Mari Kimura: MUGIC®: Mastery over Novelty
events.description: A composition colloquium featuring Mari Kimura, discussing 'MUGIC®: Mastery over Novelty.' This academic event explores innovative approaches in music and technology.

events.title: The Future of Autonomous Mobility: Agile and Collaborative Robot Autonomy (ITS Transportation Seminar)
events.organizer: Institute of Transportation Studies (ITS), UC Berkeley
events.description: Giuseppe Loianno, UC Berkeley Electrical Engineering and Computer Science Associate Professor, presents on robot autonomy. A cookie hour precedes the seminar in the ITS Library.

events.title: Akira Kurosawa: Four Recent Restorations: Yojimbo
events.description: A screening of Akira Kurosawa's 'Yojimbo,' presented as part of a series showcasing recent restorations of his films. This is a must-see for fans of classic Japanese cinema.

events.title: Laura Truffaut on François Truffaut: Day for Night
events.description: A film screening and discussion on François Truffaut's 'Day for Night,' led by Laura Truffaut. This event provides unique insights into the director's work and cinematic legacy.

events.title: Botanical Illustration: Spring Bulbs (Saturday)
events.description: A Saturday workshop dedicated to the art of botanical illustration, focusing on spring bulbs. Participants will hone their skills in a relaxing and inspiring natural setting.

events.title: Climate Journalism on Screen: Three Films on Water and Tradition
events.description: A screening of three films exploring the intersection of water, tradition, and climate change. This event is part of the Climate Journalism on Screen series, offering diverse perspectives on environmental issues.

events.title: California Men's Basketball vs Stanford
events.description: The UC Berkeley men's basketball team faces off against rival Stanford in a highly anticipated home game. Come cheer on the Golden Bears!

events.title: Special Screenings: Cairo Station
events.description: A special film screening of 'Cairo Station,' a classic of Egyptian cinema. This unique presentation offers a journey into international filmmaking.

events.title: A.I.M by Kyle Abraham
events.description: Kyle Abraham brings his acclaimed A.I.M company to Cal Performances, featuring three works that explore the rich intersections of Black and queer culture through contemporary dance. Witness powerful and thought-provoking choreography.

events.title: Somi
events.description: Vocalist and composer Somi makes her Cal Performances debut, presenting music that beautifully traverses the cultural bridges between Africa and the United States. Experience her unique blend of jazz, soul, and African traditions.

events.title: In the Mood for Love: The Films of Wong Kar Wai: The Grandmaster
events.description: A screening of Wong Kar Wai's 'The Grandmaster,' a visually stunning martial arts film, as part of the 'In the Mood for Love' series. This cinematic masterpiece explores themes of honor and legacy.

events.title: Climate Journalism on Screen: All the Walls Came Down
events.description: A screening of 'All the Walls Came Down' as part of the Climate Journalism on Screen series. This film examines critical environmental narratives and their impact.

events.title: A.I.M by Kyle Abraham
events.description: A matinee performance by Kyle Abraham's A.I.M company, featuring innovative contemporary dance at the intersection of Black and queer culture. Experience the artistry and powerful storytelling.

events.title: Canto Ostinato, An AMOC* & Sandbox Percussion Co-Production
events.description: The American Modern Opera Company (AMOC*) and Sandbox Percussion collaborate to perform Simeon ten Holt's mesmerizing 'Canto Ostinato.' This unique production showcases an innovative approach to contemporary classical music.

events.title: Takács Quartet
events.description: The second performance of the 2025–26 season by the renowned Takács Quartet, featuring a new work by Clarice Assad alongside compositions by Haydn and Debussy. Experience masterful chamber music.

events.title: Laura Truffaut on François Truffaut: Small Change
events.description: A film screening and discussion on François Truffaut's 'Small Change,' with insights from Laura Truffaut. This event offers a personal perspective on the director's beloved work.

events.title: In the Mood for Love: The Films of Wong Kar Wai: Days of Being Wild
events.description: A screening of Wong Kar Wai's 'Days of Being Wild,' an essential film in his 'In the Mood for Love' series. This cinematic journey explores themes of memory, desire, and identity.

events.title: Energy Markets Workshop (Speaker and title forthcoming)
events.description: A workshop on current topics in energy markets, featuring a forthcoming speaker and title. This event provides a platform for discussing recent developments and research in energy economics.

events.title: Beyond Delaware: Should startups incorporate in Nevada?
events.description: A discussion examining whether startups should consider incorporating in Nevada instead of the traditional Delaware. This event offers critical legal and business insights for entrepreneurs.

events.title: Startup Group Therapy (Members-only)
events.description: Startup Group Therapy (Members-only)

events.title: Black History Month Celebration at the Student Union
events.description: Honor Black History Month with free treats and an opportunity to explore local black-owned businesses on campus. This event celebrates culture and supports community entrepreneurship.

events.title: 2026 Clark Kerr Lectures: The American University in Crisis – Christopher Eisgruber, President of Princeton University (Part 1)
events.description: The first part of a distinguished lecture series by Christopher Eisgruber, President of Princeton University, examining the challenges facing American universities. This event offers critical perspectives on higher education.

events.title: Environmental and Energy Economics Seminar – Lint Barrage, ETH Zürich
events.description: A seminar featuring Lint Barrage from ETH Zürich, presenting research on environmental and energy economics. This academic session contributes to ongoing discussions on sustainability and economic policy.

events.title: Open: Art Lab
events.description: A drop-in art making session where visitors of all ages can explore their creativity through hands-on activities. All materials are provided, fostering artistic expression in a relaxed environment.

events.title: Dinner @ the eHub
events.description: Dinner @ the eHub

events.title: Special Screenings: Ch 1-3: My Undesirable Friends
events.description: A special screening of Chapters 1-3 of 'My Undesirable Friends.' This film offers a unique narrative and visual experience for audiences.

events.title: Drag Bingo
events.description: An unforgettable night of laughter, prizes, and treats hosted by Thee Leggy Pee. This free event for UC Berkeley students promises a fun and vibrant atmosphere.

events.title: Adaptation
events.organizer: UC Berkeley Department of Theater, Dance, and Performance Studies
events.description: A satiric comedy by Elaine May, directed by Joshua Gould. This performance showcases the department's theatrical talent and offers a humorous look at everyday life.

events.title: Plein AiR Patrol with Forest Stearns
events.description: An outdoor art session focused on plein air techniques with artist Forest Stearns. This event invites participants to capture the beauty of the botanical garden through art.

events.title: Rethinking Mobility: Human-Centered AI for Safe, Confident and Fun Driving (ITS Transportation Seminar)
events.organizer: Institute of Transportation Studies (ITS), UC Berkeley
events.description: Avinash Balachandran, VP of Human Interactive Driving at Toyota Research Institute, presents on human-centered AI for mobility. A cookie hour precedes the seminar.

events.title: In the Mood for Love: The Films of Wong Kar Wai: 2046
events.description: A screening of Wong Kar Wai's '2046,' a continuation of themes from 'In the Mood for Love.' This 4K digital restoration offers a stunning visual and narrative experience.

events.title: Special Screenings: Ch 4-5: My Undesirable Friends
events.description: A special screening of Chapters 4-5 of 'My Undesirable Friends.' This cinematic event continues a compelling narrative.

events.title: Chris Thile, mandolin and vocals
events.description: MacArthur Fellow and Grammy-winner Chris Thile returns to Berkeley with a captivating program of original songs and unique interpretations of classical tunes on mandolin and vocals. Experience his virtuosity and dynamic stage presence.

events.title: Yaa Samar! Dance Theatre: Gathering
events.description: Yaa Samar! Dance Theatre presents 'Gathering,' a work conceived by Samar Haddad King that explores themes of love, loss, trauma, and dislocation through movement, text, song, and puppetry. Witness a powerful and evocative performance.

events.title: Adaptation
events.organizer: UC Berkeley Department of Theater, Dance, and Performance Studies
events.description: A satiric comedy by Elaine May, directed by Joshua Gould. This performance showcases the department's theatrical talent and offers a humorous look at everyday life.

events.title: Member Event: Member Morning
events.location: Julia Morgan Hall, UC Botanical Garden at Berkeley
events.description: Members are invited to enjoy light refreshments, meet the Director, and explore the Garden with or without a docent-led tour. This exclusive event also offers first access to the Annual Garden Shop sale.

events.title: California Men's Basketball vs Pitt
events.description: The UC Berkeley men's basketball team hosts Pitt in an exciting home game. Come support the Golden Bears in this ACC matchup.

events.title: Swedish Silent Cinema: Wild Strawberries
events.description: A screening of Ingmar Bergman's 'Wild Strawberries,' a masterpiece of Swedish Silent Cinema. This film, introduced by a UC Berkeley faculty director, explores themes of memory and reflection.

events.title: Laura Truffaut on François Truffaut: Confidentially Yours
events.description: A film screening and discussion on François Truffaut's 'Confidentially Yours,' with insights from Laura Truffaut. This event provides a fascinating look into the director's final film.

events.title: Yaa Samar! Dance Theatre: Gathering
events.description: Yaa Samar! Dance Theatre presents 'Gathering,' a work conceived by Samar Haddad King that explores themes of love, loss, trauma, and dislocation through movement, text, song, and puppetry. Witness a powerful and evocative performance.

events.title: California Women's Basketball vs SMU
events.description: The UC Berkeley women's basketball team hosts SMU in a thrilling home game. Come support the Golden Bears!

events.title: Geneva Lewis, violin; Evren Ozel, piano
events.description: Violinist Geneva Lewis makes her Cal Performances debut with returning pianist Evren Ozel for a captivating program of Bach, Schumann, Schoenberg, and Schubert. Experience a masterful evening of classical music.

events.title: 2026 Stronach Baccalaureate Prize Information Session
events.description: An information session for graduating seniors interested in the Judith Lee Stronach Baccalaureate Prize, which supports public service, creative, or community-based research projects. Learn how to apply for this prestigious award.

events.title: 25 Years of Field Experiments in American Politics: What Have We Learned?
events.location: Jarvis Auditorium, Grimes Engineering Center, UC Berkeley
events.description: A comprehensive review of two and a half decades of field experiments in American politics, analyzing key findings and their impact. This academic discussion offers valuable insights into political science methodology.

events.title: Emma Lurie talk on online harms
events.description: Emma Lurie discusses the origins of online harms within platform design, regulatory frameworks, and expert discourse. This seminar provides a critical perspective on digital safety and policy.

events.title: Startup Group Therapy (Members-only)
events.description: Startup Group Therapy (Members-only)

events.title: Rebooting Tech Culture: How to Ignite Innovation and Build Organizations Where Everyone Can Thrive (Book Talk)
events.organizer: UC Berkeley (with Berkeley Society of Women Engineers implied)
events.location: Greene & Rosenblum Studio, Grimes Engineering, UC Berkeley
events.description: A book talk featuring Telle Whitney, a prominent advocate for women in technology, discussing her book 'Rebooting Tech Culture.' A reception and book signing will follow this inspiring event.

events.title: The 2026 Shiing-Shen Chern Distinguished Lecture: Holonomy in Geometry: History and Current Developments
events.description: The distinguished Shiing-Shen Chern Lecture series presents a talk on the historical and contemporary developments of holonomy in geometry. This event delves into advanced mathematical concepts and their applications.

events.title: Problem of the Month: Framing the Problem
events.description: Problem of the Month: Framing the Problem

events.title: Bob L. T. Sturm talk on MUSAiC project
events.description: Bob L. T. Sturm, lead of the MUSAiC project, discusses his work on computational creativity and music. This presentation delves into the intersection of AI and artistic expression.

events.title: Environmental and Energy Economics Seminar – Tatyana Deryugina, University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign
events.description: A seminar featuring Tatyana Deryugina from the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign, presenting research on environmental and energy economics. This academic session covers advanced topics in resource allocation and policy.

events.title: Discussion with Bob L. T. Sturm
events.description: An in-person, collaborative deep dive with Cultural Analytics speaker Bob L. T. Sturm. This interactive session provides a platform for detailed discussion and exploration of his research.

events.title: Women*'s History & Empowerment Month Tribute Night
events.organizer: UC Berkeley Student Union (in partnership with Gender Equity Resource Center)
events.location: 1st Floor of MLK Jr. Building, Game Zone Area, UC Berkeley
events.description: Celebrate Women's History Month with an evening of performers, activities, giveaways, and free food. This event, in partnership with the Gender Equity Resource Center, honors women's contributions and empowers the community.

events.title: Julia Keefe Indigenous Big Band
events.description: The Julia Keefe Indigenous Big Band celebrates and expands upon the significant contributions of Native American artists throughout the rich history of jazz. This performance offers a unique cultural and musical experience.

events.title: The English Concert: Handel's Hercules; Harry Bicket, conductor
events.description: Harry Bicket leads his acclaimed British early-music ensemble, The English Concert, in a performance of Handel's dramatic oratorio 'Hercules.' This promises to be an exceptional evening of Baroque music.

events.title: Transfer and Re-Entry Students Event
events.location: 1st Floor of MLK Jr. Building, Game Zone, UC Berkeley
events.description: A social event with refreshments and snacks specifically for transfer and re-entry students. This free event provides a welcoming environment for students to connect and build community.

events.title: Advanced Air Mobility and eVTOL: Navigating Vertical Mobility Innovation and the Public Good
events.organizer: Institute of Transportation Studies (ITS) Berkeley, co-sponsored by UC Berkeley Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering
events.location: Jarvis Auditorium, Grimes Engineering Center, UC Berkeley
events.description: A panel discussion exploring the future of advanced air mobility and eVTOL technologies, focusing on innovation and public benefit. Experts from academia, industry, and government will share insights.

events.title: Opera Parallèle: La Belle et la Bête by Philip Glass
events.description: Opera Parallèle presents Philip Glass's mesmerizing score for 'La Belle et la Bête,' merging Jean Cocteau's classic film with a live operatic performance. This innovative production promises a captivating artistic experience.

events.title: Opera Parallèle: La Belle et la Bête by Philip Glass
events.description: Opera Parallèle presents Philip Glass's mesmerizing score for 'La Belle et la Bête,' merging Jean Cocteau's classic film with a live operatic performance. This innovative production promises a captivating artistic experience.

events.title: JACK Quartet
events.description: The JACK Quartet makes its Cal Performances debut with premieres by Juri Seo and Anthony Cheung, alongside works by Hans Abrahamsen and Helmut Lachenmann. This concert features groundbreaking contemporary classical music.

events.title: Energy Markets Workshop – Will Gorman, LBNL
events.description: A workshop on energy markets featuring Will Gorman from LBNL, discussing 'Energy-Only' Interconnection Service. This session reviews current practices and considerations for its future in the energy sector.

events.title: Gesamtkunstvektoren: Perceptual Embeddings for the Performing Arts
events.description: Peter Broadwell explores new opportunities for using deep neural models in computational analyses of theater and other performing arts. This talk bridges the fields of AI, data science, and artistic research.

events.title: Graph Cities and their Applications
events.description: James Abello & Haoyang Zhang introduce 'Graph Cities,' a novel visualization tool for exploring complex large-scale networks. This presentation highlights cutting-edge data science and visualization techniques.

events.title: Cultural Analytics Workshop with Lauren Tilton
events.description: Lauren Tilton discusses her research applying digital and computational methods to the study of 20th and 21st century documentary expression and visual culture. This workshop explores innovative approaches to cultural analysis.

events.title: Computational Approaches to Pacing and Style in Television Comedy
events.description: Taylor Arnold utilizes large-scale computational methods to analyze how television production practices and narrative strategies intersect with industry changes and cultural contexts. This seminar offers data-driven insights into media studies.

events.title: The Social Foundations of Creative Influence
events.description: Noah Askin, a computational social scientist, discusses the creative process, its outcomes, and the forces that influence it. This interdisciplinary talk combines sociology and data science to understand innovation.

events.title: The Three Obstructions: Improvements in Analysis & Interface for Multimodal Retrieval
events.description: Peter Leonard identifies three barriers hindering analysis of film and television, proposing improvements in multimodal retrieval. This seminar highlights challenges and solutions in digital humanities and media informatics.

events.title: Silkroad Ensemble with Rhiannon Giddens: Sanctuary: The Power of Resonance and Ritual
events.description: The Silkroad Ensemble, joined by Rhiannon Giddens, presents a performance that encourages audience reflection through cross-cultural conversations in music and ritual. This collaboration promises a deeply moving and resonant experience.

events.title: POWER Conference on Energy Research and Policy
events.location: Spieker Forum, Haas School of Business, UC Berkeley
events.description: The Energy Institute's annual conference on energy markets and regulation, featuring research from leading scholars. This full-day event provides opportunities to engage with energy policy and business professionals.

events.title: What Dance Scholars can Learn from Warehouse Surveillance: Emic Approaches to Temporal Action Segmentation
events.description: Miguel Escobar Varela discusses changes in Southeast Asian cultural heritage, combining fieldwork with computational methods. This presentation explores new avenues for research in dance and performance studies using technology.

events.title: Cultural Analytics Workshop Week: Conclusion & Reflections
events.description: The concluding session of the Cultural Analytics Workshop Week, offering reflections on the week's discussions and discoveries. This event summarizes key takeaways and future directions in cultural data science.

events.title: Silkroad Ensemble with Rhiannon Giddens: Sanctuary: The Power of Resonance and Ritual
events.description: The Silkroad Ensemble, joined by Rhiannon Giddens, presents a performance that encourages audience reflection through cross-cultural conversations in music and ritual. This collaboration promises a deeply moving and resonant experience.

events.title: Drum Tao: The Best
events.description: The dynamic taiko drummers of Drum Tao return to Berkeley with 'The Best,' a show that blends centuries-old drumming traditions with dazzling choreography and innovative staging. Experience a powerful and visually stunning percussive spectacle.

events.title: Drum Tao: The Best
events.description: The dynamic taiko drummers of Drum Tao return to Berkeley with 'The Best,' a show that blends centuries-old drumming traditions with dazzling choreography and innovative staging. Experience a powerful and visually stunning percussive spectacle.

events.title: Théotime Langlois de Swarte, violin; Justin Taylor, harpsichord
events.description: Violinist Théotime Langlois de Swarte and harpsichordist Justin Taylor return to Cal Performances with a thrilling program of Baroque showpieces. This concert promises an evening of exquisite historical performance.

events.title: David Finckel, cello; Wu Han, piano
events.description: Cellist David Finckel and pianist Wu Han return to Berkeley to perform works by Bach, John Corigliano, Debussy, Chopin, and Britten. This celebrated duo offers an evening of masterful chamber music.

events.title: Writing With and Beyond AI: Fieldnotes from Computer-Mediated Poetry
events.description: A discussion on writing with AI, focusing on generating unique and impactful computer-mediated poetry. This session explores the creative potential and ethical considerations of AI in artistic practice.

events.title: Discussion with Kyle Booten
events.description: An in-person, collaborative deep dive with Cultural Analytics speaker Kyle Booten. This session offers an opportunity for in-depth engagement with his work on computer-mediated poetry and AI.

events.title: 2026 Berkeley-Stanford Graduate Student Conference in Modern Chinese Humanities
events.organizer: Center for Chinese Studies, UC Berkeley
events.description: A two-day conference for graduate students focusing on modern Chinese humanities, featuring keynote speakers and paper presentations. This academic event fosters research and scholarly exchange.

events.title: Academy of Distinguished Alumni Banquet 2026
events.organizer: Academy of Distinguished Alumni (ADA) at Berkeley Civil and Environmental Engineering
events.description: The annual gala to induct new members into the Class of 2025 of the Academy of Distinguished Alumni. This event celebrates outstanding achievements and contributions to civil and environmental engineering.

events.title: Energy Markets Workshop – Omer Karaduman, Stanford University
events.description: A workshop on energy markets featuring Omer Karaduman from Stanford University. This session provides a platform for discussing innovative research and policy implications in the energy sector.

events.title: Energy Markets Workshop (Speaker and title forthcoming)
events.description: A workshop on energy markets, with speaker and title to be announced closer to the event date. This session offers opportunities for insights into evolving energy economics.

events.title: School of Information 2026 Commencement
events.description: A commencement ceremony to honor the graduating class of 2026, featuring a keynote speaker, student speakers, and student awards. This celebratory event marks a significant milestone for graduates.

events.title: California Football vs UCLA
events.description: The UC Berkeley Golden Bears football team hosts UCLA in an anticipated home game. This matchup is a highlight of the football season.

events.title: California Football vs Wagner
events.description: The UC Berkeley Golden Bears football team plays a home game against Wagner. Come support your team in this exciting contest.

events.title: California Football vs Clemson
events.description: The UC Berkeley Golden Bears football team hosts Clemson in a significant home game. This highly anticipated matchup is a key event on the football schedule.

events.title: California Football vs Virginia Tech
events.description: The UC Berkeley Golden Bears football team faces Virginia Tech in a home game. Don't miss this opportunity to cheer for your team.

events.title: California Football vs Wake Forest
events.description: The UC Berkeley Golden Bears football team plays a home game against Wake Forest. Join fellow fans to support the Golden Bears.

events.title: California Football vs Stanford (129th Big Game)
events.description: The 129th Big Game sees the UC Berkeley Golden Bears football team host rival Stanford. This historic rivalry game is a highlight of the collegiate sports calendar.

events.title: California Football vs Pittsburgh
events.description: The UC Berkeley Golden Bears football team plays a home game against Pittsburgh. This is an exciting opportunity to see the team in action.
